newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine nominates Chernobyl negotiator for IAEA.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine nominates Chernobyl negotiator for IAEA.

text.p: Ukraine has named its top Chernobyl negotiator as a candidate for Secretary General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) due to be re-elected in December 1997, a government spokesman said on Friday.
The spokesman said Ukrainian government and president Leonid Kuchma have already sent to IAEA headquarters in Vienna application naming Environment Minister Yuri Kostenko a Kiev's choice.
Kostenko, 46, heads Ukrainian delagation at talks with the Group of seven industrialised nations on the closure of the Chernobyl nuclear plant, the site of the world's worst nuclear disaster in 1986.
Kuchma has promised to finally close the Chernobyl station by the year 2000. The West has promised $3.1 billion worth of grants and credits in exchange.
Ukraine has five nuclear power plants, including Chernobyl, which produce more than 40 per cent of the former Soviet republic's energy.
Switzerland, Italy, Egypt, Iran and Zambia have also named their candidates for the top IAEA post.
